bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R. Elwood Logan, September 26, 1940

div1.p: Hench thanks Logan for lending him Peabody's pamphlet, "The Conquest of Yellow Fever," and requests a copy of Peabody's bibliography.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R. Elwood Logan, September 26, 1940
div1.opener:
September 26, 1940
Mr. R. Elwood Logan
The American Museum of Natural History
Central Park West at 79th Street
New York, N. Y.
My dear Mr. Logan:
div1.p:
I wish to thank you very kindly for
lending me the pamphlet, “The Conquest of Yellow Fever”
by Dr. Peabody. I have read it carefully and am returning
it to you by separate post. In the back of this pamphlet, you
mentioned a complete bibliography of the yellow fever work
available (pages 32 and 33). I wondered if I could have one
of these complete bibliographies. I wrote to Dr. Peabody
but he did not have one.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
